intro: Persoonia pungens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved geebung, is an evergreen shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and showy, yellowish-green flower spikes. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its flowers are insect-pollinated and produce small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Persoonia pungens is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
